content:
Air Quality Smoke Report for local area 9/3/17

Incident: Liberty Fire Wildfire
Released: 25 min. ago

Smoke Forecast Outlook issued September 03, 2017 at 11:01 AM EDT

Outlook for Rice Ridge-Meyers East

http://wildlandfiresmoke.net/outlooks/2017/Montana#Area4

http://svc.mt.gov/deq/todayair/



Smoke: With the high pressure, smoke will be slow to lift this morning in low lying areas where it settled overnight. As fires pick up communities downwind may have smoke mix to the surface this afternoon.

Fire: Yesterday most fires showed significant growth. Rice Ridge, Meyers, Alice Creek, and Little Hogback added 12,716 acres, 7,163 acres, 4,153 acres and 1,247 acres respectively. Extremely hot and dry conditions will persist for one more day across the Northern Rockies. These dry conditions will combine with breezy westerly winds and an unstable atmosphere this afternoon and evening to create critical fire weather conditions across western Montana.

Other: Easterly winds will set up over the area early Monday lasting into Tuesday. Anticipate reduced roadway visibility (AM) especially if RH recovers to+70% (mid- elevation valleys). For additional information please refer to Missoula City-County Health Department in the "links" below.

Smoke: With the below.

Smoke: below.
RiceRidge,
